title: [Gameplay] Elementalist Lux Ult
body:
Summoners Rift
Playing as any champ (specific instance - Vi).  Others I have played with have experienced this as well.

When Lux uses her ultimate, the width of the beam is FAR wider than any of her other skins.  I was hit at about 50-75% further from the center of the beam than I would have been hit if I had been hit with another Lux skin ultimate.  I know that sounds like an exaggeration but it was a significantly wider beam than normal.

replies.body:
Hey! 

We're working on a clarity pass, based on some of the feedback we'd received. At the moment, her (Q) issues (the fade out) has been pushed to live. We are in the process of adjusting her (W),  (E) and her (R), which, if all goes according to plan and is clean, you should see the changes in 7.1.  All changes are currently on the PBE, but here's a quick breakdown - 

**Original Elementalist (R) v. her base (R):** 

https://giphy.com/gifs/l3vR8zEfRWYwIfLFe

**Updated (R) v. her base (R):**

https://giphy.com/gifs/l3vReEk2pNTsvEeqc

**(Q), (W), and (E) updates**:

http://imgur.com/a/wPsnh

As a heads up, updates were done on all forms, but I didn't take 10 screen grabs/make 10 gifs. :P 

Hopefully this clears things up! I checked the hitboxes of her base v. this skin, and they're the same. :)
Thank you :D

Of course! Always glad to increase clarity and consistency! Since ultimate skins change so much, some clarity can be lost, due to us wanting to make something wicked cool. :P Luckily, you guys and gameplay reeled us back in. ^-^

But your change doesn't seem to have done anything, the ults are identical except the beam at the end is jaggy instead of smooth. Doesn't make it any easier to see and happens after the ult, just looks worse.

Players noted that they couldn't "see" E. Lux ult until it was too late to react. We found a difference between the R indicator and the E. Lux indicator; when base Lux begins cast, the warning beam appears immediately -- with E. Lux, it started wider and quickly condensed into the warning beam. The R has been updated to display the warning beam immediately.
